ygData.subject: Re: fPIC problem on 64-bit RH Enterprise Linux 5
ygData.msgSnippet: ... I had a similar problem compiling on a 64-bit Ubuntu system. I was able to get it working by giving the following options when configuring sundials:

--- In cantera@yahoogroups.com, "Mirko" <mvukovic@...> wrote:
>
> --- In ca=
ntera@yahoogroups.com, "Mirko" <mvukovic@> wrote:
> >
> > Hi,
> > 
> > I do=
wnloaded cantera 1.7.0 yesterday from sourceforge.
> > 
> > I get an error =
when running "make python-install" with the message
> > that I need to reco=
mpile with -fPIC.
> > 
> > I have seen several emails with the same topic. =
 But some of them
> > indicate that the problem was resolved in version 1.7=
.1.  Where can I
> > find that version (I looked briefly at the CVS and did=
 not see
> > anything newer than 1.7, except for Makefile.in)?
> > 
> > (I =
am not super-comfortable modifying the makefiles, but with clear
> > enough=
 instructions I am willing to do it).
> > 
> > In case it is of relevance, =
I think I have 64-bit python, simply
> > because my python2.4 sits in the /=
usr/lib64 directory.  (It came
> > pre-installed)
> > 
> > Thank you very m=
uch,
> > 
> > Mirko
> >
> 
> I looked at the preconfig script, and of cours=
e, the PIC flag is
> already set there.  I tried diving into the python mak=
e file and the
> python file, but those waters are too deep for me.
> 
> Mi=
rko (still looking for a rescue boat :-)
>

I had a similar problem compili=
ng on a 64-bit Ubuntu system. I was
able to get it working by giving the fo=
llowing options when
configuring sundials:

./configure --with-cflags=3D-fP=
IC --with-cppflags=3D-fPIC

Hope this helps.
